author: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall
method: In a small saucepan melt the butter and make a roux with the flour. Cook for a couple of minutes, stirring to prevent the roux from burning. Stir in the warm beer by degrees, until you have a thick but smooth sauce. Add the grated cheese and stir until melted. You should now have a thick paste. Mix in the mustard and Worcestershire sauce and season well with black pepper.  Lightly toast and butter the bread, then pile up the cheesy mixture on each slice. Cook under a hot grill for a few minutes, until browned and bubbling.
ingredients: 50g/2oz flour,  50g/2oz butter,  250ml/9oz strong beer, warmed,  250g/9oz strong cheddar, grated,  2tsp English mustard,  2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce,  black pepper,  4 large slices granary bread
